ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class controls the robot wheel motors. It contains all the methods to make the robot move.
    Author:
    Edward Huang, Hugo Parent-Pothier, Sophie Deng

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Navigation.Side
      Location of the wheel relative to the center of the robot.

    • Method Detail

      • floatWheels

        public static void floatWheels()
        Floats the wheels

      • moveForward

        public static void moveForward(double distance,
                               boolean immediateReturn)
        Moves the robot forwards a distance.
        Parameters:
        distance - The distance to move. A negative distance implies going backwards.
        immediateReturn - To give immediate return or not.

      • rotate

        public static void rotate(double angle,
                          boolean immediateReturn)
        Rotates the robot by certain angle. Positive angle is clockwise
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle to rotate by.
        immediateReturn - To give immediate return or not.

      • traverseTunnel

        public static void traverseTunnel(java.util.Stack<Coordinate> s,
                                  int TLLx,
                                  int TLLy,
                                  int TURx,
                                  int TURy,
                                  Project.Tunnel tunnel)
        This method makes the robot traverse the tunnel
        Parameters:
        stack - The stack where the path is saved to.
        TLLx - The lower left X coordinate of the tunnel
        TLLy - The lower left Y coordinate of the tunnel
        TURx - The upper right X coordinate of the tunnel
        TURy - The upper right Y coordinate of the tunnel
        tunnel - The direction of the tunnel

      • travelByPath

        public static void travelByPath(java.util.Stack<Coordinate> s,
                                java.util.LinkedList<Coordinate> path)
        This method moves the robot with the input path and adds the path to the stack
        Parameters:
        stack - The stack where the path is saved to.
        path - The the path the robot will take

      • travelByPath

        public static void travelByPath(java.util.LinkedList<Coordinate> path)
        This method moves the robot with the input path, but does not save the path
        Parameters:
        path - The path which contains coordinates to travel to

      • dropRing

        public static void dropRing()
        This method makes the robot move back full speed to drop the ring

      • face

        public static void face(double x,
                        double y)
        turns the robot to face a coordinate
        Parameters:
        x - The x the robot should be facing
        y - The y the robot should be facing

      • travelTo

        public static void travelTo(double x,
                            double y)
        This method controls the robot to move towards x, y (tile position).
        Parameters:
        x - The x position to travel to.
        y - The y position to travel to.

      • turnTo

        public static void turnTo(double theta)
        This method turns the robot in place to the absolute angle theta.
        Parameters:
        theta - The angle to turn to.

      • calculateAngle

        public static double calculateAngle(double x,
                                    double y,
                                    Odometer odo)
        This method calculates the angle which the robot has to turn to reach tile position x, y using the data from the odometer which is passed into the method.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position which is used to calculate the angle.
        y - The y position which is used to calculate the angle.
        odo - The odometer from which to obtain the robot's current position and heading.
        Returns:
        The angle which the robot has to turn to reach tile position x, y using the data from the odometer which is passed into the method.

      • convertAngle

        public static int convertAngle(double radius,
                               double width,
                               double angle)
        This method computes how much the wheels should turn to get to an angle
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the wheels.
        width - The wheelbase of the robot.
        angle - The angle to turn.
        Returns:
        The rotation in degrees needed for the robot to turn the given angle.

      • angleDiff

        public static double angleDiff(double a1,
                               double a2)
        This method calculates the minimum difference between two angles a1 and a2.
        Parameters:
        a1 - The first angle.
        a2 - The second angle.
        Returns:
        The minimum difference between two angles a1 and a2.

      • stop

        public static void stop()
        Stops both right and left motors

      • setSpeed

        public static void setSpeed(int speed)
        Set speed for both motors
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed at which to set the motors to.

      • backwards

        public static void backwards()
        Move left and right motors backwards.

      • isNavigating

        public static boolean isNavigating()
        Checks if the robot is navigating.
        Returns:
        True if robot is navigating, False if not navigating.

      • isTurning

        public static boolean isTurning()
        Checks if the robot is turning.
        Returns:
        True if robot is turning, False if not turning.

      • getTacho

        public static int getTacho(Navigation.Side side)
        Gets the tacho count of the wanted wheel
        Parameters:
        side - The side of the wheel to get the tacho count of
        Returns:
        Tacho count of the wheel
